title: Stephen Yu
text: At UCLA, I pursued a rigorous curriculum in Statistics and Data Science, emphasizing Machine Learning. My experience at UCLA’s Tsiang Lab and internships at Northrop Grumman and Electrum Homes, developed my skills in data analysis, software engineering, and applying Machine Learning models to real-world challenges. This blend of academic rigor and practical experience has fueled my passion for leveraging Machine Learning to solve complex problems and drive innovation in data science and engineering.

title: Projects
text:
Python: scikit-learn, scipy, numpy
Jan 2024 – Present

Devised a novel supervised learning algorithm using clusters and Gaussian hotspots within each class.
Compared accuracy to K-Nearest Neighbor on real-world datasets resulting in an average boost of 3.5%.
Advantages over KNN include increased interpretability, reduced prediction cost of O(K), and a probabilistic insight.

title: Projects
text:
Yelp Sentiment Mining
R: Tidyverse, car, mclust, class, MASS, pROC
Sep 2023 – Dec 2023

Preprocessed 50,000+ IMDB reviews using K-Means Data Clustering and measured inertia to find optimal hyperparameter.
Applied Logistic Regression, KNN, LDA, QDA, and Random Forest with K-Fold CV receiving a maximum accuracy of 88%.

title: Projects
text:
Smart Sprite
Python: pygame, numpy, pandas
Aug 2023 – Sep 2023

Constructed an unsupervised reinforcement learning algorithm on an agent to train and progress through a 2D platformer.
Addressed exploration vs exploitation dilemma with ε-greedy, upper confidence bound (UCB), and optimistic initialization methods.
Agent learned to complete levels with enemies and obstacles 20% faster than human players.

title: Projects
text:
Synthetic Data Analysis and Optimization
R
May 2023 - Jun 2023

Used stochastic gradient descent to iterate and converge on true beta values of a data set containing 20 predictors.
Implemented and compared constant step, backtracking line search, and Polyak’s Heavy Ball Momentum for accuracy and speed.

title: Projects
text:
Cyborgs
C++
May 2022 - Jun 2022

Created an action arcade video game in which the player needs to collect all apples in a given map before being attacked by cyborgs.
Utilized pointers and random number generators to dynamically store enemies and objects, creating cyborg AI.

title: Experience
section: UCLA Tsiang Lab - Los Angeles, CA
text:
UCLA Tsiang Lab - Los Angeles, CA
Undergraduate Researcher
Sep 2023 – Dec 2023

Scripted an algorithm in Python (Numpy, Pandas, BS4) to scrape 25 predictors for 4577 observations from assorted websites.
Imputed data using MICE and leveraged SMOTE to create 3000+ synthetic data points for underrepresented class.
Utilized dimension reduction techniques such as Lasso Regression and Stepwise BIC to reduce to 9 significant predictors.
Implemented supervised learning models in R (mclust, class, MASS) resulting in an average F1-score of 83%.

title: Experience

Provided valuable insight and guidance for improved theory and optimization leading to 100% accuracy and 100% coverage.
